snippet: Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda made a blunt appeal to the public Friday on restarting one of Japan’s idled nuclear plants.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Yoshihiko Noda makes blunt appeal to the public on restarting the first of Japan's idled nuclear plants, saying that keeping the plants offline could cause blackouts and economic chaos at a time when he country's struggling economy can least afford it; despite increasingly dire warnings about the economic effects of a sudden turn from nuclear energy, a majority of Japanese remain unconvinced that it is safe to turn the plants back on.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda made a blunt appeal to the public Friday on restarting one of Japan’s idled nuclear plants.

headline.main: Japan’s Premier Seeks Support for Using Nuclear Power
headline.print_headline: Japan’s Premier Seeks Support for Using Nuclear Power
